comment: Would never take again, even if I was guaranteed an A. Tests were nothing like homework or practice tests. I knew all of the material from the notes and still didn't make a B on the exam. The whole class and the professor are bologna.

The class isn't easy, but if you go to class every day, do the homework, and do the practice tests you will be fine.   Yanosky is a great professor. Very clear and tries to make class interesting, even though not all of the material is exactly fun. It doesn't hurt that he is incredibly attractive.
Worst schooling experience of my life
I'm not a fan of this course being required, but Yanosky is okay. He's very smart, but can be unfair in my opinion.
Take the other professor. He's better at explaining concepts, even though tests don't reflect the material..
Lots of group projeccts and pop quizzes.  Take Holmes instead.
You can tell he is a very smart professor, but his exams are tricky and confusing.  Take someone else.
This class at UGA is very hard and he is a tough grader.  Tests are not like lecture.  Avoidd
Tests are extremely tough and it seems to be completely different from the lecture.  He is the toughest teacher for this m class
Great class.  Went fast.  Didn't like having to turn in notes, but is useful for SAS Certification Exam (optional).

Lots of information.  You will learn a lot about programming in R, but you need to understand STATISTICS prior to the last few weeks of class. I enjoyed and will continue to learn this programming language.  Take all the Quizzes and attend class.  If you follow the book and use the provided code as you go, you will do fine.

This class is Programming in R. It was incredibly difficult, the homeworks were insanely hard. I am B+/A- student and fought all semester just to make above an F. Dr. Y is wonderfully helpful and understanding, but this class just didn't work for me. I've had other classes with him, no issues. I'd definitely recommend him, despite my own issues.

The class was Base Programming in SAS. Very straightforward course, exams and homeworks were not easy but they were fair. Some of it was review for me. Dr. Y is willing to do whatever he could to help, watch his instructional videos! Make sure to do the quizzes in advance and get the grade you need, read for each quiz, attend class (synchronous)
Dr. Y was demanding and the material required nearly 80% self-teaching, as is the nature of all online courses... BUT you WILL LEARN, A LOT, if you do what he expects.
If you need a stats class this is a great one to take and he makes it very easy to understand.  I took his class online and as long as you stay on top of the material and quizes it is an easy A.

I took this class online, so I can't comment on how hot Professor Y is, but I can tell you he's a nice guy. This professor knows his STATS and knows how to teach it, but you have to put in the time and energy.  The class requires projects, a weekly quiz, and weekly reading. Make sure you following the directions for the projects.

This man knows his statistics. Yes, he expects a great deal from his students (You're expected to thoroughly read the text before class, attend class, present your homework in a detailed professional manner, spend a lot of time on the take-home tests) but you will learn the material. After all, this isn't high school anymore. Very helpful and clear

Avoid the online class. There were times when Vista wouldn't log me in and he wouldn't accept that. I would have enjoyed this class a lot more had I not taken the online class. Homework sets are like exams and no final. Instead you have a final project. He's very picky too so look over your work before you turn it in.

I took the online class, if you do prepare to do a bit of work. You meet in a chatroom type thing once a week, and you lose points for not attending. His instructions are VERY clear, he says over and over what is acceptable and what is not, so there's no reason to screw up. My only issue was that 'class-time' was boring and it was hard to focus.

Avoid the online class. He tried to impose as many in-class rules on it as possible. Treats the class as if it were a high school class. You need a secret decoder ring after every online lecture, and have 15 minutes to enter the code to get credit for attendance. Where do they find these clowns? Much better professors for your money. Avoid! 1/10

Don't waste you your time taking this class online, it's more money (as is any online class @ KSU), for more headache. Professor will not take late homework for any reason, even valid reasons related to WEBCT! Material was somewhat interesting, if in the classroom setting, this may be a good class but the online version is for the birds.
Great teacher.  Very clear, very intelligent, very helpful.  One of the few teachers I have had that actually cares.  He's also extremely handsome!
He will NOT accept late assignments for any reason.

Dr. Yanosky is an excellent professor! He made the material so interesting and it was actually fun to do.  The exams are just like the homeworks. You do have to read the book for quizzes, but those are easy as well. The easiest "A" I've made in a while.

Dr. Yanosky is a great professor! He's extremely helpful-will meet with you anytime and really wants to see you succeed. His class is really difficult though and you do have to study the book and come to class. Be prepared to work hard in this class. It is worth it though.

VERY GOOD professor. Extremely clear about what he expects. Very helpful. He gives examples of homework assignments so you know what he expects. Super nice guy too. Stay on top of everything and you will succeed!

A great professor and an excellent teacher. Explains concepts very clearly and sees to it that each and every student understands them. Always willing to help. Very lucky to have a teacher like him!!!
I thought the class was hard even though Dr. Yanosky genuinely cares about this students and subject matter. If you can't keep with homework or pop quizes, this class is not for you.
No Comments
